```{r setup, warning = F, message = F, cache = T, echo = F}
knitr::opts_chunk$set(echo = F, warning = F, message = F, fig.pat = 'fig/')

# packages
library(tidyverse)
library(sf)
library(leaflet)
library(mapview)
library(shiny)
library(rsconnect)
library(gridExtra)
library(shinycssloaders)

# data
data(ascidat)
data(ascithr)
data(suppdat)
data(psa)

## globals

# crs
prj <- '+proj=longlat +datum=WGS84 +no_defs'

# colors (boxplots, bi goals, scores)
ctcol <- RColorBrewer::brewer.pal(3, 'RdYlGn') %>% 
  rev
bicol <- ctcol[c(1, 3)]
sccol <- c('#d7191c', '#abd9e9', '#2c7bb6')

# palettes (scores, bi goals)
scpal <- colorNumeric(palette = sccol, na.color = 'yellow', domain = ascidat$scr)
bipal <- colorFactor(
  palette = bicol,
  na.color = 'yellow',
  levels = c('met', 'not met'))

# env vars to eval
evvar <- c('Phosphorus_as_P_mgPerL', 'Nitrogen_Total_mgPerL', 'XCDENMID', 'PCT_SAFN', 'SpecificConductivity_uSPercm', 'Temperature_Deg_C') 
names(evvar) <- c('Phosphorus (mg/L)', 'Total Nitrogen (mg/L)', '% Shading', '% Sands and Fines', 'Conductivity (mS/cm)', 'Temperature (C)')

# base theme
pbase <- theme_minimal(base_family = 'serif', base_size = 15) +
  theme(
    panel.border = element_rect(colour = 'black', fill = NA, size = 0.5),
    legend.position = 'top', 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    panel.grid.major = element_blank()
  )
```

```{r reactives}
# thresholds
thrsh <- reactive({
  
  # input
  thr <- input$thr 
  
  out <- ascithr %>% 
    filter(bigls %in% thr)
  
  return(out)
  
})

# asci data joined with thresholds, met/not met categories
# includes psa join
ascicat <- reactive({
  
  # input
  thrsh <- thrsh()
  refonly <- input$refonly %>% 
    as.logical
  
  # add threshold
  out <- ascidat %>% 
    left_join(thrsh, by = 'tax') %>% 
    mutate(
      scrcat = ifelse(scr < bival, 'not met', 'met')
    )

  # filter rc if T
  if(refonly)
    out <- out %>% 
      filter(sit1 %in% 'rc')
  
  return(out)
  
})

# tabular data from ascicat of ranges, by site type
ascitabsit <- reactive({
  
  # input
  ascicat <- ascicat()
  
  out <- ascicat %>% 
    select(sampleid, ind, tax, scr, sit2) %>% 
    filter(!is.na(sit2)) %>% 
    group_by(ind, tax, sit2) %>% 
    summarise(
      `Minimum` = min(scr, na.rm = T),
      `25th percentile` = quantile(scr, 0.25, na.rm = T),
      `Median`  = median(scr, na.rm = T), 
      `75th percentile` = quantile(scr, 0.75, na.rm = T),
      `Maximum` = max(scr, na.rm = T)
    ) %>% 
    group_by(ind) %>%  
    mutate(
      tax = as.character(tax),
      tax = ifelse(duplicated(tax), '', tax)
    ) %>% 
    ungroup %>% 
    mutate(
      ind = as.character(ind), 
      ind = ifelse(duplicated(ind), '', ind)
    ) %>% 
    rename(
      Index = ind, 
      Group = tax,
      `Site type` = sit2
    )
    
  return(out)
  
})

# tabular data from ascicat of ranges, by region
ascitabpsa <- reactive({
  
  # input
  ascicat <- ascicat()
  
  out <- ascicat %>% 
    select(sampleid, ind, tax, scr, PSA6) %>% 
    filter(!is.na(PSA6)) %>% 
    group_by(ind, tax, PSA6) %>% 
    summarise(
      `Minimum` = min(scr, na.rm = T),
      `25th percentile` = quantile(scr, 0.25, na.rm = T),
      `Median`  = median(scr, na.rm = T), 
      `75th percentile` = quantile(scr, 0.75, na.rm = T),
      `Maximum` = max(scr, na.rm = T)
    ) %>% 
    group_by(ind) %>%  
    mutate(
      tax = as.character(tax),
      tax = ifelse(duplicated(tax), '', tax)
    ) %>% 
    ungroup %>% 
    mutate(
      ind = as.character(ind), 
      ind = ifelse(duplicated(ind), '', ind)
    ) %>% 
    rename(
      Index = ind, 
      Group = tax,
      Region = PSA6
    )
    
  return(out)
  
})

# filter supp index data by rc if refonly is true
supprct <- reactive({
  
  # input
  refonly <- input$refonly %>% 
    as.logical
  
  out <- suppdat
  if(refonly)
    out <- out %>% 
      filter(sit1 %in% 'rc') %>% 
      select(-sit1)
  
  return(out)
  
})

# map data, static
mapsta <- reactive({
  
  # input
  ascicat <- ascicat()

  # get index and taxa for mapping 
  # get most recent visit
  out <- ascicat %>% 
    filter(smps == 1) %>%
    filter(!is.na(scrcat)) %>% 
    group_by(site) %>% 
    filter(date %in% max(date)) %>% 
    ungroup %>% 
    dplyr::select(site, date, ind, tax, scr, scrcat, lon, lat) %>% 
    filter(!is.na(lon)|!is.na(lat)) %>% 
    mutate(
      lon = as.numeric(lon), 
      lat = as.numeric(lat)
      )
  
  return(out)
  
})

# map data, dynamic filtered by index and taxa
mapdyn <- reactive({
  
  # input
  indsel <- input$indsel
  taxsel <- input$taxsel
  mapsta <- mapsta()
  
  # filter by index and taxa
  out <- mapsta %>% 
    filter(ind %in% indsel) %>% 
    filter(tax %in% taxsel) %>% 
    st_as_sf(coords = c('lon', 'lat'), crs = prj)
  
  return(out)
  
})

# combined selected environmental variable, other indices, and asci data
cmbdat <- reactive({
  
  # input
  ascicat <- ascicat()
  supprct <- supprct()
  evvr <- input$evvr
  olin <- input$olin

  # supp data to join
  suppjn <- supprct %>% 
    filter(ind %in% olin)

  # new indices
  out <- ascicat %>% 
    rename(
      scrnew = scr,
      indnew = ind
      ) %>% 
    left_join(suppjn, by = 'sampleid') %>%
    mutate(
      scrdif = scrnew - scr
    ) %>% 
    select(one_of(c('sampleid', 'scrnew', 'indnew', 'ptile', 'bival', 'ind', 'tax', 'scr', 'scrdif', evvr)))
  
  return(out)
  
})

# get r2 value of indices with selected env var
cmbdatr2 <- reactive({
  
  # input
  cmbdat <- cmbdat()
  evvr <- input$evvr
  
  out <- cmbdat %>% 
    group_by(indnew, tax) %>% 
    rename(
      xvar = !! evvr
    ) %>% 
    nest %>% 
    mutate(
      r2 = map(data, function(x){

        frm <- 'scrnew ~ xvar'
        if(evvr %in% c('Phosphorus_as_P_mgPerL', 'Nitrogen_Total_mgPerL'))
          frm <- gsub('xvar$', 'log10(1 + xvar)', frm)
        
        frm <- frm %>% 
          as.formula
        r2 <- lm(frm, data = x) %>% 
          summary %>% 
          .$r.squared %>% 
          round(2)
        
        return(r2)
        
      })
    ) %>% 
    select(-data) %>% 
    unnest
  
  return(out)

})

# get r2 value of existing indices with selected env var
suppdatr2 <- reactive({
  
  # input
  evvr <- input$evvr
  supprct <- supprct()
  
  out <- supprct %>% 
    group_by(ind) %>% 
    rename(
      xvar = !! evvr
    ) %>% 
    select(ind, scr, xvar) %>% 
    nest %>% 
    mutate(
      r2 = map(data, function(x){

        frm <- 'scr ~ xvar'
        if(evvr %in% c('Phosphorus_as_P_mgPerL', 'Nitrogen_Total_mgPerL'))
          frm <- gsub('xvar$', 'log10(1 + xvar)', frm)
        
        frm <- frm %>% 
          as.formula
        r2 <- lm(frm, data = x) %>% 
          summary %>% 
          .$r.squared %>% 
          round(2)
        
        return(r2)
        
      })
    ) %>% 
    select(-data) %>% 
    unnest
  
  return(out)
  
})
```

This interactive dashboard provides an overview of scores for the Algal Stream Condition Index using all statewide data.  The dashboard includes three main sections for viewing score distributions, relationships with environmental variables, and comparisons with existing indices.  The navigation bar on the left can be used to switch between sections.  The selection menus below can toggle different biointegrity goals and the types of sites that are shown.  The biontegrity selection changes the goals that are viewed on the plots as either a dotted reference line or the criteria that defines the number of sites that meet or do not meet the goal depending on the plot.  The second selector chooses whether all sites are shown on the dashboard or only those that are referencs sites for calibrating the ASCI.  Please contact [Susanna Theroux](mailto:susannat@sccwrp.org) for technical questions about the ASCI and [Marcus Beck](mailto:marcusb@sccwrp.org) for questions about the dashboard.

## Score distributions {.tabset}

Score distributions for the ASCI can be viewed by site types (reference, intermediate, stressed), by PSA regions (Central Valley, Chaparral, Deserts Modoc, North Coast, Sierra Nevada, South Coast), as static maps, or as interactive maps.  For each tab, the scores can be viewed as the disribution of values or whether scores meet or do not meet the selected biointegrity goal. For the maps, only the most recent sample at a site is shown. The dotted red line in the plots shows the selected biointegrity goal for the relevant ASCI.  

### By Site types {.tabset .tabset-pills}

#### Scores

```{r}
# boxplot by site types
output$sitbox <- renderPlot({

  # input
  ascicat <- ascicat()

  # toplo 
  toplo <- ascicat %>% 
    filter(!is.na(sit2))

  # plot
  p <- ggplot(toplo, aes(x = sit2, y = scr)) + 
    geom_boxplot(outlier.size = 1, aes(fill = sit2), alpha = 0.7) + 
    geom_hline(aes(yintercept = bival), linetype = 'dashed', colour = 'tomato1', size = 1) +
    facet_grid(ind ~ tax) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = ctcol) +
    scale_y_continuous('Index Score') + 
    theme_minimal(base_family = 'serif', base_size = 16) +
    theme(
      axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1), 
      axis.title.x = element_blank(), 
      panel.border = element_rect(colour = 'black', fill = NA, size = 0.5), 
      legend.position = 'none'
    ) 
  
  return(p)
  
})
plotOutput('sitbox', height = '600px') %>% withSpinner()

# table of ranges
wellPanel(id = "tabsit", style = "overflow-y:scroll; height:400px; max-height: 400px; background-color:#ffffff", 
  renderTable({ascitabsit()})
)
```

# proportion met/not met by site type
output$sitpro <- renderPlot({
  
  # input
  ascicat <- ascicat()
  
  # get percent sites in each category by type
  toplo <- ascicat %>% 
    group_by(sit2, ind, tax, scrcat) %>% 
    summarise(
      n = length(scrcat)
    ) %>% 
    ungroup %>% 
    rename(Goal = scrcat) %>% 
    filter(!is.na(sit2)) %>% 
    filter(!is.na(Goal))
  
  p <- ggplot(toplo, aes(x = sit2, y = n, fill = Goal)) +
    geom_bar(stat = 'identity', position = 'fill', colour = 'grey', alpha = 0.8, width = 0.75) + 
    facet_grid(ind ~ tax) + 
    scale_y_continuous('Proportion', expand = c(0, 0)) +
    scale_fill_manual(values = bicol) + 
    theme_minimal(base_family = 'serif', base_size = 16) +
    theme(
      axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1), 
      axis.title.x = element_blank(), 
      panel.border = element_rect(colour = 'black', fill = NA, size = 0.5), 
      panel.grid.major = element_blank(), 
      panel.grid.minor = element_blank(), 
      legend.position = 'top'
    ) 
  
  return(p)
  
})
plotOutput('sitpro', height = '600px') %>% withSpinner()

## Relationships with environmental variables

These plots show simple correlations of index scores with selected environmental variables.  The top row of plots show relationships of the California Stream Condition Index (CSCI, macroinvertebrate infex), D18 (southern California diatom index), S2 (southern California soft-bodied algal index), and H20 (southern California hybrid algal index) with the selected variable.  The bottom panels shows relationships of the ASCI scores with the same variable.  The linear fit between the index and the environmental variable is shown in blue and the selected biointegrity goal for each ASCI index is shown as the dotted red line. R-squared values (proportion of explained variance) for each panel are shown in parentheses.

```{r}
selectInput('evvr', 'Select environmental variable:', choices = evvar)
```

```{r}
output$evplo <- renderPlot({

  # input
  cmbdat <- cmbdat()
  cmbdatr2 <- cmbdatr2()
  suppdatr2 <- suppdatr2()
  supprct <- supprct()
  evvr <- input$evvr
  
  # evvr name
  xlab <- names(evvar[evvar %in% evvr])
  
  ## prep plot data from combined object

  # old indices
  toplo_old <- supprct %>% 
    left_join(suppdatr2, by = 'ind') %>% 
    mutate(r2 = paste0('(', r2, ')')) %>% 
    unite('ind', ind, r2, sep = ' ')
  
  pold <- ggplot(toplo_old, aes_string(x = evvr, y = 'scr')) +
    geom_point(alpha = 0.7, size = 1.3) +
    geom_smooth(method = 'lm', se = FALSE) +
    facet_wrap( ~ ind, ncol = 4) +
    scale_y_continuous('Index score', expand = c(0, 0)) +  
    scale_x_continuous(xlab) +
    pbase
  
  # new indices
  toplo_new <- cmbdat %>% 
    left_join(cmbdatr2, by = c('indnew', 'tax')) %>% 
    mutate(r2 = paste0('(', r2, ')')) %>% 
    unite('indnew', indnew, r2, sep = ' ')

  pnew <- ggplot(toplo_new, aes_string(x = evvr, y = 'scrnew')) +
    geom_point(alpha = 0.7, size = 1.3) +
    geom_smooth(method = 'lm', se = FALSE) +
    geom_hline(aes(yintercept = bival), linetype = 'dashed', colour = 'tomato1', size = 1) +
    facet_wrap(indnew ~ tax, ncol = 3) +
    scale_y_continuous('ASCI score', expand = c(0, 0)) +  
    scale_x_continuous(xlab) +
    pbase

  if(evvr %in% c('Phosphorus_as_P_mgPerL', 'Nitrogen_Total_mgPerL')){
    pold <- pold + scale_x_log10(xlab)   
    pnew <- pnew + scale_x_log10(xlab) 
  }
  
  grid.arrange(pold, pnew, ncol = 1, heights = c(0.35, 1))
  
})
plotOutput('evplo', height = '800px') %>% withSpinner()
```

## Comparisons with existing indices

These plots compare ASCI scores with existing indices including the California Stream Condition Index (CSCI, macroinvertebrate infex), D18 (southern California diatom index), S2 (southern California soft-bodied algal index), and H20 (southern California hybrid algal index.  The menu can be used to select the existing index to compare to the ASCI. The top plots show simple correlations between ASCI scores and the selected index, whereas the bottom plot shows the difference between ASCI scores and selected index compared to observed scores for the selected index.  Blue lines shows the linear fit in each plot, whereas the dotted line shows the 1:1 line in the top plots and the zero line in the bottom plots.

```{r}
selectInput('olin', 'Select index for comparison:', choices = c('CSCI', 'D18', 'S2', 'H20'))
```

```{r}
output$olplo <- renderPlot({
  
  # input
  cmbdat <- cmbdat()
  olin <- input$olin

  lms <- c(0, 1.6)
  xlab <- paste(olin, 'Score')
  ylab <- paste('ASCI -', olin, 'Score')

  toplo <- cmbdat %>% 
    filter(!is.na(scr))
 
  p1 <- ggplot(toplo, aes(x = scr, y = scrnew)) +
    geom_point(alpha = 0.6, size = 1) +
    geom_abline(intercept = 0, slope = 1, linetype = 'dashed') +
    geom_smooth(method = 'lm', se = F) +
    facet_grid(indnew ~ tax) +
    scale_y_continuous('ASCI Score', limits = lms) +
    scale_x_continuous(xlab, limits = lms) +
    pbase 

  p2 <- ggplot(toplo, aes(x = scr, y = scrdif)) +
    geom_point(alpha = 0.6, size = 1) +
    geom_hline(yintercept = 0, linetype = 'dashed') +
    geom_smooth(method = 'lm', se = F) +
    facet_grid(indnew ~ tax) +
    scale_y_continuous(ylab) +
    scale_x_continuous(xlab, limits = lms) +
    pbase

  grid.arrange(p1, p2, ncol = 1)
  
})
plotOutput('olplo', height = '950px') %>% withSpinner()
```
